#Text=Morgantown
#Text=Morgantown is in Monongalia
#Text=County , West Virginia and is the county seat .
#Text=It is home to the West Virginia University Mountaineers .
#Text=It has been described as the #1 small city in America .

#Text=Its main claim to fame is the Morgantown PRT , a " Personal Rapid Transit " system that was supposed to be the future of public transportation in the 1970s but found no takers elsewhere after cost overruns and delays .

column1: #Text=By plane
#Text=Morgantown Municipal Airport ( MGW ) .
#Text=Has nonstop service from Baltimore , Maryland , and Pittsburgh , Pennsylvania .
#Text=Pittsburgh International Airport ( PIT ) is north of Morgantown , and has scheduled commercial service from many airports in the U.S. and other countries .
#Text=By car
#Text=Major routes in and out of Morgantown include :
#Text=I-79 , which runs in a north-south fashion through the eastern side of Morgantown
#Text=I-68 , which runs in an east-west fashion through the southern side of Morgantown
#Text=WV 43 , a section of the Mon-Fayette Expressway connecting the Morgantown area to Fayette County , Pennsylvania
#Text=US 119 , which runs in a north-south fashion through downtown
#Text=US 19 , which runs through downtown
#Text=WV 7
#Text=WV 705
#Text=Morgantown is :
#Text=77 miles ( 120 km ) south of Pittsburgh , Pennsylvania ;
#Text=385 miles ( 615 km ) north of Charlotte , North Carolina ;
#Text=528 miles ( 845 km ) east of Chicago , Illinois ;
#Text=218 miles ( 350 km ) west of Washington , D.C.
#Text=By bus
#Text=Megabus .
#Text=Service from Pittsburgh and Washington , D.C. Buses stop at Mountaineer Station , 1112 Van Voorhis Road .
#Text=Get around

#Text=The PRT ( Personal Rapid Transit ) is a unique urban rail system that provides the primary mode of transportation for students , faculty , and staff of the university , and for residents of the Morgantown area .
#Text=There are five station stops : Walnut , Beechurst , Engineering , Towers , and Medical .
#Text=The PRTs transport between Downtown Morgantown , the WVU Downtown Campus , the Evansdale Campus and the Medical Center Complex .
#Text=$0.50/ride ; free with WVU ID .
#Text=Regular hours ( during school year ) : M - F 6:30AM-10:15PM , Sa 9:30-5PM .
#Text=No Sunday service , unless the day before classes begin is a Sunday , in which case PRT runs on Saturday hours .
#Text=No service on days when class is not in session .
#Text=Extended hours for special events , most notably football and basketball games .
#Text=Summer hours : M - F 6:30AM-6:15PM , Sa 9:30AM-5PM .
#Text=The Mountain Line is a public transit bus system providing service in and around the city of Morgantown .
#Text=The service is free to students , with nominal fares for the public .
#Text=The city of Morgantown subsidizes the bus system , making the fares very affordable .
#Text=Since a lot of recreational activities are available close to one another they are easily accessible by car and foot .
#Text=There is no need to worry about parking .
#Text=There are four parking garages with a total of 1,600 parking spots in Morgantown .
#Text=They are at University Ave and Chestnut Street , Pleasant Street , Spruce Street and Wharf Street .
#Text=See
#Text=Core Arboretum , ☏ +1304 293-5201 .
#Text=Monongahela Boulevard .
#Text=Daily , dawn to dusk .
#Text=91 acres of forest with 3.5 miles of trails and 3 acres of lawns planted with specimen trees .
#Text=Dorsey 's Knob .
#Text=An excellent view of the Rolling Hills of West Virginia at no cost .
#Text=Museums
#Text=The Royce J. and Caroline B. Watts Museum , 401 Evansdale Drive , ☏ +1 304-293-4609 , ✉ wattsmuseum@mail.wvu.edu .
#Text=MWF Sa : 1-4PM .
#Text=Mineral Resources Building Room 125 .
#Text=Dedicated to preserving the social , cultural , and technological history of the coal , oil and natural gas industries of the state of West Virginia . free .
#Text=Cook-Hayman Pharmacy Museum , 1132 Health Sciences North , ☏ +1304 293-5212 .
#Text=Tours by appointment booked through website .

#Text=Built to resemble a 19th-century drugstore , the museum includes texts , medicines , furnishings , apothecary jars , mills , bottles , scales and other devices used by pharmacists over the past 100 years .
#Text=Free .
#Text=Morgantown Glass Museum , 1628 Mileground Road , ☏ +1 304-685-5760 , ✉ mgt_glass@hotmail.com .
#Text=By appointment only .
#Text=Please call. .

#Text=Displays thousands of glass pieces from the late 19th century to around 1980 , made in factories of the Morgantown Glass Company , the Seneca Glass company and the Gentile Glass Company in the Morgantown area .
#Text=Old Morgantown Glass Collector 's Guild Glass Museum , 709 Beechurst , ✉ oldmorgantown@aol.com .
#Text=W - Sa 10AM-3PM , Su 1-5PM .
#Text=Scott 's Run Museum ( exit 155 from I-79 , Osage ) , ☏ +304-599-1931 .
#Text=Sa 1PM-4PM , or by appointment .
#Text=Celebrating and preserving the history of coal and the coal boom area in Morgantown .
#Text=Free .
#Text=Morgantown History Museum , 175 Kirk St , ☏ +1 304-319-1800 , ✉ info@morgantownhistorymuseum.org .
#Text=MWFSa 10AM-4PM .
#Text=Tu , Th 11AM-4PM . local and regional history
#Text=West Virginia University 's Creative Arts Center , ☏ +1 304-293-4841 .
#Text=Gallery hours F noon-9PM ; Sa 1PM-9PM. .
#Text=4 theatres and 1 performance hall .
#Text=All exhibitions , lectures , and receptions are free and open to the public .
#Text=Monongalia Arts Center , 107 High Street ( between the historic Hotel Morgan and the old Morgantown Post Office on South High Street ) , ☏ +1304 292-3325 , ✉ info@monartscenter.com .
#Text=M - F 11AM - 7PM , Sa 11AM - 4PM .
#Text=A non-profit arts and culture center serving Monongalia County and surrounding areas .
#Text=MAC offers classes in the visual and performing arts , and houses the Benedum Gallery , Davis Gallery , Tanner Theatre , and a gift shop featuring artwork by various local artists .
#Text=Spectator sports
#Text=West Virginia Mountaineers , WVU Coliseum , 3450 Jerry West Blvd. ( between Blue and Gold Gate entrances ) , toll-free : +1 800 WVU-GAME .
#Text=M - F 9AM – 5PM .
#Text=WVU sports teams are undoubtedly Morgantown 's highest-profile attraction .
#Text=The Mountaineers field teams in seven men 's sports , 10 women 's sports , and one coeducational sport ( rifle shooting ) , mostly as members of the Big 12 Conference .
#Text=As at most other big schools , the football and men 's basketball teams are the biggest draws .
#Text=Notably , when WVU fills Milan Puskar Stadium for football games , the stadium becomes the largest " city " in the state by a healthy margin .
#Text=While a small number of WVU fans are n't exactly friendly to opposing fans , violence is largely nonexistent , and neutral visitors should have no trouble .

#Text=Like the WVU campus , the school 's main athletic venues are disjointed — the football stadium is at the Health Sciences campus ; the WVU Coliseum ( several indoor sports , most notably basketball ) and some other venues are at the Evansdale campus ; and the baseball stadium is at University Town Centre in Granville .
#Text=West Virginia Black Bears , Monongalia County Ballpark ( University Town Centre , Granville ) , ☏ +1304 293-7910 , ✉ wvblackbears@gmail.com .
#Text=The Black Bears , which moved from Jamestown , New York , after the 2014 season , play in the New York –
#Text=Penn League , a short-season Class A league , and share WVU 's ballpark .
#Text=The season runs from mid-June to early September .
